text:
Raleigh, Durham among top 10 best cities to be a driver Jul 17, 2015, 7:00am EDT Share Rebecca Troyer Managing Editor Triangle Business Journal Rebecca Troyer Managing Editor Triangle Business Journal Home of the Day John West Durham and Raleigh are among the 10 best U.S. cities for drivers, according to a recentâ€¦ more Beltine and I-40 traffic notwithstanding, Durham and Raleigh rank No. 7 and No. 10, respectively, among the best U.S. cities for drivers, according to a new report by personal financial website WalletHub . The rankings are based on 21 metrics of the driving experience, including road conditions, weather, gas prices, rates of car thefts, accident likelihood compared to the national average and even car washes per capita. Greensboro is no. 4, Winston-Salem is No. 9 and Charlotte is No. 36. The five worst cities for drivers? New York, Washington, D.C., Philadelphia, San Francisco and Detroit.
